thread.title: Woman Makes Money By Losing Weight - Jennifer Dennison Weight-Loss Story
thread.title_full: Woman Makes Money By Losing Weight - Jennifer Dennison Weight-Loss Story

author: Sarah Schreiber
title: Woman Makes Money By Losing Weight - Jennifer Dennison Weight-Loss Story
text:
This Woman Made $4,800 Betting on Her Own Weight Loss 
She lost 102 pounds and gained some serious cash — plus a whole new life. By Sarah Schreiber Feb 3, 2017 Jennifer Dennison of Houston weighed 405 pounds when she fell asleep at the wheel in 2015, exhausted and lethargic as a result of her recent weight gain . She immediately knew it was time to take control of her health. "I wasn't sleeping well , I was exhausted, my diet was not great," Dennison told ABC News. "If anything, I would skip a whole bunch of meals and then binge later ." Bad habits like those can be tough to shake, but Dennison was sure she could do it — so sure, in fact, that she put cold, hard cash behind it. Advertisement - Continue Reading Below Looking for ways to stay motivated — she'd already lost 75 pounds at this point by working out with a group and overhauling her eating habits — she stumbled across a weight-loss gambling site . The site works just the way you'd expect: You wage a bet that you'll succeed in your weight-loss goal , and if you don't reach it, you lose your money. Dennison's objective? To lose 100 pounds in 10 months while betting $100 on each month. 
Jennifer's story of how she used HealthyWage to maximize her motivation while winning money for losing weight is... https://t.co/jJMVXTX1Pn — HealthyWage (@HealthyWage) February 1, 2017 Most Popular "I went to the website and started playing around with the algorithms and figured how much money I would be potentially able to make in a short amount of time," Dennison told ABC News . At the end of the 10 months, the scale read 102 pounds lighter — and her bank account balance read $4,800 higher . She'd done it. Watching that $100 leave her bank account every month, Dennison said, is what kept her going . "For me, the goal was just to show up," she explained. Just goes to show you that betting on and believing in yourself seriously pays off!
